# Daily Scrum Report for Michael Kim

## Sprint Overview
We are at the beginning of our two-week sprint for the HealthTrack Pro project. Our focus is on establishing the basic project structure, implementing user authentication, and setting up profile management. As a backend developer, your role is crucial in laying the foundation for these core features.

## Personal Progress and Next Steps

### Completed
No tasks have been completed yet, as we are in the initial stages of the project.

### In Progress
- Setting up the backend structure
- Creating the initial database schema

### Upcoming Tasks
1. Assist with further backend setup
2. Participate in the technical planning session for database schema and architecture discussion
3. Implement user registration API endpoint
4. Develop secure password storage mechanism
5. Prepare for the Basic Activity Tracking feature implementation

## Challenges and Blockers
Currently, no specific blockers or challenges have been reported. However, as we progress, we should be mindful of potential security and compliance requirements (e.g., HIPAA) for health data handling.

## Task Visualization

![Task Diagram](https://mermaid.)

## Notes and Reminders
- Daily stand-ups are scheduled for 9:30 AM
- Use Slack for daily communication and Jira for sprint and backlog tracking
- Confluence will be set up soon for documentation purposes
- Keep in mind the technology stack: Node.js and Express.js for backend development, PostgreSQL for database management
- Stay informed about the upcoming technical planning session for database schema and architecture discussion

Remember to communicate any concerns or blockers as they arise. Good luck with the initial setup, Michael!
